onlineAddresses.caption: Book: Good Inside: A Guide to Becoming the Parent You Want to Be
TIME: How Dr. Becky Became the Millennial Parenting Whisperer
NYT: Dr. Becky Doesn’t Think the Goal of Parenting Is to Make Your Kid Happy
The Guardian: How Dr Becky Kennedy became Instagram’s favourite ‘parent whisperer’
The Cut: The Frenetic, Fraught Appeal of Instagram’s Parenting Whisperer
NY Times: How Dr. Becky Spends Her Sundays

speakerTopic.text: Life can be overwhelming—especially now. We’re living in a time where even as adults we don’t have solid answers or a sense of certainty. Add in kids, work, and family, and say hello to anxiety, worry, and stress! In this conversation, Dr. Becky teaches audiences how to understand your anxiety and stress, how to build resilience, and simple coping skills to get you through even the most difficult times. The impact of this conversation will be wide-ranging: you will find that these strategies and skills will help manage stressful situations with your partner, with your kids, and at work.
speakerTopic.title: Managing Stress and Anxiety in the Home and at Work

speakerTopic.text: One of the best gifts we can give our kids is confidence—the kind that lasts a lifetime. For many of us, this means helping our kids “feel good” by jumping in to boost their mood when they’re feeling unsure (“You’re a good soccer player, too!”). But what if this approach, while well-intentioned, actually undermines the development of confidence? In this conversation, Dr. Becky teaches audiences the importance of guiding kids to trust all of their feelings (good and bad), ways to develop a growth mindset, how to separate what your kids do from who they are, and how to help them feel truly good inside.
speakerTopic.title: Feeling Good Inside: How to Build Long-Lasting Self-Confidence in Kids
Communication Skills at Home and in the Workplace

speakerBioSummary.text:
• Dr. Becky Kennedy is a clinical psychologist and mom of three, named “The Millennial Parenting Whisperer” by TIME Magazine. 
  • She empowers parents by translating big ideas into simple, actionable strategies for parents to use in their homes.
  • Dr. Becky has amassed a loyal and highly engaged community of over 1.4M followers on Instagram, created a library of popular parenting workshops, launched a top-rated podcast as well as a newsletter, and published a Potty Handbook.
  • Her podcast, Good Inside with Dr. Becky, immediately went to #1 on the Apple Podcasts “Kids & Family” chart upon launching and her first book, Good Inside: A Guide to Becoming the Parent You Want to Be, became a #1 New York Times bestseller.
  • She also launched a game-changing, first-of-its-kind platform; Good Inside Membership, a dynamic parenting hub that offers Dr. Becky’s complete parenting content collection and access to Good Inside-trained experts.
  • Dr. Becky speaks regularly for corporations from law firms to Wall Street and tech firms on the topics of stress, anxiety, and improving communication in the workplace.

speakerBiography.text:
Dr. Becky Kennedy is a clinical psychologist and mom of three, named “The Millennial Parenting Whisperer” by TIME Magazine, who’s rethinking the way we raise our children. She specializes in thinking deeply about what’s happening to kids and translating these big ideas into simple, actionable strategies for parents to use in their homes. Dr. Becky's goal is to empower parents to feel sturdier and more equipped to manage the challenges of parenting.

Dr. Becky has amassed a loyal and highly engaged community of over 1.4M followers on Instagram, created a library of popular parenting workshops, launched a top-rated podcast as well as a newsletter, and published a Potty Handbook. She launched a game-changing, first-of-its-kind platform; Good Inside Membership, a dynamic parenting hub that offers Dr. Becky’s complete parenting content collection, a judgment-free, like-valued community, and access to Good Inside-trained experts––all in one place. Her first book, Good Inside: A Guide to Becoming the Parent You Want to Be, became a #1 New York Times bestseller.

Her weekly podcast, Good Inside with Dr. Becky, immediately went to #1 on the Apple Podcasts “Kids & Family” chart upon launching, was placed on the coveted "New and Noteworthy" list, landed the #26 spot on the iTunes “Top Podcasts” chart, and made Apple Podcasts “Best Shows of 2021” list. Each week, she takes on tough parenting questions and delivers actionable guidance—all in short episodes, because she knows time is hard to find as a parent.

Dr. Becky received a BA in Psychology and Human Development, Phi Beta Kappa and summa cum laude, from Duke University and a Ph.D. in Clinical Psychology from Columbia University.

speakerNameSubheading.text: Clinical Psychologist, Parenting Expert, and #1 New York Times Bestselling Author
